item.title: Charity add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Charity add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A girl likes to be crossed a little in love now and then. It is something to think of" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Charity add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "From the very beginning— from the first moment, I may almost say— of my acquaintance with you, your manners, impressing me with the fullest belief of your arrogance, your conceit, and your selfish disdain of the feelings of others, were such as to form the groundwork of disapprobation on which succeeding events have built so immovable a dislike; and I had not known you a month before I felt that you were the last man in the world whom I could ever be prevailed on to marry." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Charity add a quote by Jane Austen
Charity add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Charity add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "First of all," he said, "if you can learn a simple trick, Scout, you'll get along a lot better with all kinds of folks. You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view--until you climb into his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Charity add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I wanted you to see what real courage is, instead of getting the idea that courage is a man with a gun in his hand. It's when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what. - Atticus Finch" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Charity add a quote by J. Lawrence
item.description: "But to be liked, you must never disagree. And if you never disagree, it's like only breathing in and never breathing outl A man can suffocate on courtesy. What if God wanted to be liked instead of loved? What if the almighty delayed every decision until He was sure it would please the majority?" -- J. Lawrence

item.title: Charity add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies ahead of us are tiny matters compared to what lives within us." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Charity add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Charity add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Read the best books first, or you may not have a chance to read them at all." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Charity add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Charity add a quote by Barbara Tuchman
item.description:
"Books are the carriers of civilization. Without books, history is silent, literature dumb, science crippled, thought and speculation at a standstill. Without books, the development of civilization would have been impossible. They are engines of change (as the poet said), windows on the world and lighthouses erected in the sea of time. They are companions, teachers, magicians, bankers of the treasures of the mind. Books are humanity in print.
[<i>Bulletin of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</i>, Vol. 34, No. 2 (Nov. 1980), pp. 16-32]" -- Barbara Tuchman

item.title: Charity add a quote by Arthur Miller
item.description: "A small man can be just as exhausted as a great man." -- Arthur Miller

item.title: Charity add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "We must live together as brothers or perish together as fools." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Charity add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Charity add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Faith is taking the first step even when you can't see the whole staircase." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Charity add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Don't criticize what you can't understand." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Charity add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "All I can be is me- whoever that is. " -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Charity add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Charity add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin

item.title: Charity add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears." -- John Lennon

item.title: Charity add a quote by Tupac Shakur
item.description: "Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside while still alive. Never surrender." -- Tupac Shakur

item.title: Charity add a quote by Tupac Shakur
item.description: "Reality is wrong. Dreams are for the real." -- Tupac Shakur

item.title: Charity add a quote by Terry Tempest Williams
item.description: "I believe every woman should own at least one pair of red shoes." -- Terry Tempest Williams

item.title: Charity add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Charity add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Charity add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Charity add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Charity add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry
